page.title: 19Coleshill: A Village Study.
page.content: Coleshill has a church,which was built in 1450.There is an average of 2 Weddings, 4 Christenings and 2 Funerals each year.The church altar and most houses are owned by the National Trust.Some years ago a famous potter died and left Â£7000 to the church.They give it to all school leavers.There aren't many children,because there are no jobs.There's a post office, a general store and a nursery with about 30 children.There is 1 pub called Radnor Arms,named after Lord Radnor,who lived in Coleshill House which was burnt down in 1952.The grounds are now used as nursery gardens.There is a war memorial in memory of those who died in the 1st and 2nd World War.Also there is 1 bus stop.
